timeline.author: robnielsen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,410 +1,399 @@
 <xml>
-	<!--
-	//    Please keep messages ordered by increasing command number!
-	//
-	// The header is not an official Insteon concept. The boundary
-	// between header and message is the point where enough information
-	// is available to determine the full length of the incoming message.
-	// Sometimes that's just two bytes, sometimes 6 or 9.
-	//
-	->
+	<!-- // Please keep messages ordered by increasing command number! // // The header is not an official Insteon concept.

replies.bodyText: Maybe we should exclude comments in XML from formatting.
replies.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: I hope that will also stop it from messing up license headers on XML files. We saw that happen when applying it in openhab-core.
replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText:
I found that openhab/static-code-analysis#375 fixes the license formatting issues in SAT 0.10.0-SNAPSHOT though the plugin configuration was missing so I've fixed that with openhab/openhab-core#1442.
We probably want to apply something similar for all XML files, so you could test that by adding
formatCommentJoinLines=false
if that doesn't help, all XML comment formatting can be disabled with:
formatCommentText=false
replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText: This appears to be fixed in the latest commit.
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.author: robnielsen

-<!-- device types
-
-#
-#       PLEASE KEEP PRODUCT KEYS IN INCREASING ORDER:
-#
-#	- first the devices with insteon assigned product keys
-#	- then X10 devices (key starting with X)
-#	- then Insteon devices with fake keys (starting with F)
-#
-
-#
-Example entry:
-
-<device productKey="F00.00.05">
-     <model>2456-D3</model>
-     <description>LampLinc V2</description>
-     <feature name="dimmer">GenericDimmer</feature>
-     <feature name="lastheardfrom">GenericLastTime</feature>
- </device>
-
- -->
